4月27日在我去泰國旅遊不在家期間，合租人董怡萱在凌晨1到2點，一個多小時在各種追趕、毆打、欺凌取樂我的貓！非常凶狠足力的踢踹、毆打幾十次我那沒有一點反抗能力的小貓，甚至提著它的尾巴不放下來聽著我的貓慘叫取樂三分半鐘之長！還把貓關在貓砂盆里10多分鐘有餘，將活動門抵住電視櫃又拿靠枕塞住縫隙讓貓咪無法出來無法呼吸，她就站在一旁聽著貓的慘叫笑！把貓按在沙發上掐住脖子，一邊自己發出興奮的令人毛骨悚然的尖叫！這一系列令人發指的虐貓行為被我在客廳一角的攝像頭全程記錄下來。以下僅為幾秒的gif截圖已如此令人發指，貓全程哀嚎但都沒有一點防衛攻擊動作，受到的傷害可想而知。
目前董怡萱對此事毫無歉意，事發時我立即電聯她不接甚至按掉繼續虐貓，理智溝通她也表示就是要打貓，報警隨便的挑釁態度。在相關部門調解後依舊毫無愧疚，從未真誠道歉。

在本港，虐待動物是由《防止殘酷對待動物條例》（第169章）及其相關規例（第169A章）規管的。在此條例下，虐待動物的定義廣泛，任何人士如採取或不採取行動而導致動物遭受不必要的痛苦，即可界定為虐待動物的行為。

暴力行為
任何人如主動做出虐待行為或容許其照顧的動物遭受「不必要的痛苦」，即屬暴力對待動物。暴力行為包括打、踢或惡待動物，使任何動物負荷過重或將其折磨或激怒等。

Dear sir/madam,

An intolerable incident induced by HKUST UG student named 董怡萱 has came under attention of the public. I am hereby writing to express the urge of handling the issue in order to withhold the reputation of HKUST, its fellow students and their alumni.

The incident was unfolded when several photos were posted on a renown Hong Kong online discussion forum - LIHKG, with the heading「UST 內地女生虐打同住人嘅貓」, link as below,
https://lih.kg/1132346

From those photos, evidently Miss Dong was attacking a cat maliciously. Also, form the snapshots of Miss Dong's communication with her flatmate, she has not shown a single bit of regret about her brutal actions. Meanwhile, a negative impression about UST student is spreading due to her misconduct and I believe the administration should be well aware of the subsequent adverse effects.

With the wishes to make HKUST a better place for education, I genuinely hope that HKUST would take follow-up actions with regards to the incident.

Best regards,
你個名

An intolerable incident induced by HKUST UG student named 董怡萱 has came under attention of the public. I am hereby writing to express the urge of handling the issue in order to withhold the reputation of HKUST, its fellow students and their alumni.

The incident was unfolded when several photos were posted on a renown Hong Kong online discussion forum - LIHKG, with the heading「UST 內地女生虐打同住人嘅貓」, link as below,

With the wishes to make HKUST a better place for education, I genuinely hope that HKUST would take follow-up actions with regards to the incident.

Best regards,
